page.title: 16NATURALHISTORY OF PENDLESIDE
page.content: Habitat ranges from the bleak moorland of Pendle Hill to the gentler, wooded banks of Pendle Water and its tributar ies, enabling a rich variety of plants and animals to survive, as there is little or no pollution despite quite large numbers of visitors to the area, although erosion of footpaths is a problem in some areas: on Pendle Hill and in Fell Wood.Maintenance carried out by Conservation Volunteers using stone, Pine needles and wood chips. Danger of fire is a worry in Summer & beaters and fire-breaks are left in the woods.There is an abundance of wild life:some species,such as Daubent on's Bat(water bat), Pine Hawk Moth, Peregrine and Dotterel are quite rare.
